description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bn6u3","text":"This protocol describes isolation of nuclei from fresh-frozen human knee cartilage for use in Omics analyses, including RNA-sequencing of ATAC-sequencing. Tissue dissociation was the most critical step in optimization which was monitored by nuclei yield, integrity and purity. Methods for quality control are also described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

Protocol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a7ga","text":"*Diluent buffer in Distilled Nuclease free water and sterile filtered before use (see Recipes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73olf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vjrk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"79dq6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"628sm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvv5b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cft1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpssp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7qeo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vl9c","text":"Nuclei Isolation Protocol Using the Singulator S200","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"699he","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kqda","text":"The Singulator S200 Automated Tissue Dissociation System (from S2 Genomics) is programmable and thus allows reproducible, operator-independent nuclei preparation. We use fresh snapfrozen tissues stored in Liquid Nitrogen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdn88","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enm1g","text":"1.0. The buffer recipes are prepared fresh for each nuclei experiment. These custom reagents are pre-chilled and loaded into the Singluator Single Shot holder. The Single Shot holder has two 15 ml conical tube slots for each of the S200 bays of the Singulator. One slot is labeled \"Buffer\" where we load the Washing Buffer, the other slot says \"Enzyme\" where we load the Lysis Buffer. Each 15 ml conical tube contains 3 ml of the buffers in their respective tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qoav","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5olfi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c085v","text":"1.1.\tPrior to loading 200mg of tissue into to the Singulator cartridge, it needs to be finely shaved and minced into small pieces using a scalpel. The tissue is minced on a petri dish kept on dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbtq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l704","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"s2cj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arrd8","text":"1.2.\tTransfer tissue fragments to a pre-cooled Singulator Nuclei Isolation Cartridge (kept at -20ºC), add 75 ul of RNase inhibitor (40 U/ul) directly into the disruption chamber of the Nuclei Isolation Cartridge. Using the custom Low Volume nuclei isolation program, the final volume in the cartridge is 3 ml, corresponding to 3,000 units of RNase inhibitor total.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":230,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bk8nn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21j2","text":"1.3.\tRun the Low Volume custom program on the Singulator: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k4t0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mujm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f6m3k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbp1q","text":"1.4.\tRemove cartridge from Singulator, puncture the aluminum seal to collect the nuclei suspension. Pass this suspension through 20 μm and 10 μm strainers into a 50-ml LoBind conical tube on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43lp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24qth","text":"If the pestle is difficult to remove, due to negative pressure, let the pressure resolve and then remove the pestle. If some tissue homogenate is left in the tissue loading compartment, you can aspirate with a pipette and pass through a 40 μm strainer. Then combine this with the nuclei fraction that had passed through the 40 μm filter in the Singulator and pass through 20 μm and 10 μm strainers to remove tissue and cellular debris.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1g4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chkc9","text":"1.5.\tTransfer the flow-through to a 5 ml LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fsbb","text":"1.6.\tCentrifuge at 500 rcf for 5 min at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"domqr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d1p8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sdt4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bupo0","text":"1.7.\tRemove supernatant carefully and resuspend in 400μL PBS + Recombinant Albumin 0.03 mg/ml + 1U/μl RNase Inhibitor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i0m1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l20","text":"1.8.\tTo remove cellular debris, spin down at 4℃, 150 rfc for 10 min to pellet the nuclei and retain the small debris in the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rbpi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29nbc","text":"1.9.\tRemove supernatant and resuspend in 400μL PBS + Recombinant Albumin\n(0.03mg/ml) + 1U/μl RNase Inhibitor. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlvqu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chkev","text":"1.10. Count nuclei using a Countess II FL Automated Cell Counter (AOPI staining).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44ilu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrv7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63dcp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kg6u","text":"1.11. Nuclei should be visualized under a microscope at 40x or 60x magnification (AOPI staining) to assess nuclear membrane integrity, according to the nuclear integrity quality check guidance by 10x (https://10xgenomics.com).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":201,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"dbpkn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g4p9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3lvq2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54ak6","text":"A: High-quality nuclei have well-resolved edges. Optimal quality for single-cell gene expression libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ur4i","text":"B: Mostly intact nuclei with minor evidence of blebbing. Quality single-cell gene expression libraries can still be produced.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vbd5","text":"C: Nuclei with strong evidence of blebbing. Proceed at your own risk.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e29i2","text":"D: Nuclei are no longer intact. Do not proceed!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aavk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ja1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1coqa","text":"1.12. Centrifuge at 500 rcf for 5 min at 4°C and remove the supernatant without disrupting the nuclei pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbko9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3blpp","text":"1.13. Based on the nuclei concentration estimated at step 1.10, resuspend nuclei pellet in chilled Diluted Nuclei Buffer to a target concentration of 4,000 – 5,000 nuclei/ul, for a target nuclei recovery of 20,000 nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f3o1","text":"* Put only 5 μL into the PCR tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s90q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brvu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1dh5","text":"1.14. Proceed immediately to Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression User Guide (CG000338) and minimize the time between nuclei preparation and chip loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":213.51818181818177,"id":483337,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Screen
